se.cbb.jprime.prm

Interface AcyclicityVerifier

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NaiveAcyclicityVerifier

    public interface AcyclicityVerifier
    Interface for verifiers of acyclicity on a PRM dependency structure or induced Bayesian network.

    There are two acyclicity conditions of different strengths:

    1. The structure itself is acyclic, i.e. the "template graph" is acyclic. This is the stricter of the two.
    2. The structure itself is not acyclic, but the complete Bayesian network induced by the PRM entities are acyclic. This is weaker (and significantly tougher to verify), but may be desirable when modelling more complex PRMs.
    An aspect to note similar to acyclicity is the existence of "parallel arcs", that is, dependencies with the same parent and child but with different slot chains. Such are perfectly allowed, unless otherwise stated.

    For more details, see section 4.1, Learning Probabilistic Relational Models, Friedman et al., 1999.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void isEntityAcyclic(Structure struct)
      Verifies that a PRM realisation (Bayesian network induced by skeleton, structure and entities), are acyclic.
      void isStructureAcyclic(Dependency dep, Structure struct)
      Verifies that the structure resulting from adding a dependency is acyclic, preconditioned on the structure being acyclic before the addition.
      void isStructureAcyclic(Structure struct)
      Verifies that a PRM structure is in itself acyclic, i.e., the stronger of the two conditions (see also isEntityAcyclic()).

    • Method Detail

      • isStructureAcyclic

        void isStructureAcyclic(Structure struct)
                        throws DependencyException
        Verifies that a PRM structure is in itself acyclic, i.e., the stronger of the two conditions (see also isEntityAcyclic()).
        Parameters:
        struct - the structure.
        Throws:
        DependencyException - if structure invalid.

      • isStructureAcyclic

        void isStructureAcyclic(Dependency dep,
                      Structure struct)
                        throws DependencyException
        Verifies that the structure resulting from adding a dependency is acyclic, preconditioned on the structure being acyclic before the addition. This corresponds to the stronger condition, see isStructureAcyclic().
        Parameters:
        dep - the dependency to be added.
        struct - the existing structure. Assumed to be valid.
        Throws:
        DependencyException - if dependency cannot be added.

      • isEntityAcyclic

        void isEntityAcyclic(Structure struct)
                     throws DependencyException
        Verifies that a PRM realisation (Bayesian network induced by skeleton, structure and entities), are acyclic. This is the weaker, of the two conditions (see also isStructureAcyclic()).
        Parameters:
        struct - the structure, providing access also to entities, etc.
        Throws:
        DependencyException - if PRM realisation is invalid.
